creator: alvaro@opal.ws
text:
Version 5.0.27 (not listed above) ++When i finished to configure a new connector
HTTPS, and the server stored the configuration in the server.xml, some extra
attributes were written in the <connector... tag, the last valid attribute was
clientauth="false". I delete manually the extra attributes and the server runs
clean.
The writer writes all the attributes, this is not a bug.
creator: yoavs@computer.org

text:
Created attachment 12187
actual server.xml configuration file after commit changes button pressed
creator: alvaro@opal.ws
alvaro@opal.ws
text:
<Connector enableLookups="true" keystoreFile="C:\devel\apache\tomcat-5.0.27
\conf\keys.sto" keystorePass="xxx" port="8443" redirectPort="-1" 
scheme="https" secure="true" sslProtocol="TLS" algorithm="SunX509" 
clientauth="false" keypass="ultradevel" keystore="C:\devel\apache\tomcat-5.0.27
\conf\keys.sto" keytype="JKS" protocol="TLS" ***secure="true"***>
      <Factory className="org.apache.coyote.tomcat5.CoyoteServerSocketFactory" 
keystoreFile="C:\devel\apache\tomcat-5.0.27\conf\keys.sto" keystorePass="xxx"/>
    </Connector>

---------------
Parse Fatal Error at line 24 column 350: Attribute "secure" was already 
specified for element "Connector".
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Attribute "secure" was already specified for 
element "Connector".
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 30936 ***
creator: yoavs@computer.org
